notesStmt.note: Several folios partly mutilted. Numerous folios missing. Imperfect at the beginning and at the end.
A note of sale, dated 2113 (1802), between Yuda ibn Avraham Al-ḥa᾿zi and Mosheh ibn Yosef Shahad, inscribed, folio 117r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Two fragments of Midrash ha-gadol, attributed to David Adani.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each; many of the quires and separate leaves are missing. Signatures in Hebrew letters at the end of a quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Two Yemenite semi-cursive scripts of late 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Midrash Hag-Gadol. Genesis. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2378.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 23 July 1881: inscribed, folio [262v].
